title: Aggregation Function — aggregate
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{        # Download a shapefile of U.S. (polygon data)        url <- "https://www2.census.gov/geo/tiger/GENZ2020/shp/cb_2020_us_state_20m.zip"        download.file(url, destfile = "polygon/us_states.zip")                # Unzip the downloaded file and save locally        unzip("polygon/us_states.zip", exdir = "polygon/us_states")        us_states <- st_read("polygon/us_states/cb_2020_us_state_20m.shp")        saveRDS(us_states, "polygon/us_states.rds")                # Load the saved polygon data with Massachusetts as an example        us_states <- readRDS("polygon/us_states.rds")        state <- "MA"        polygon_data <- st_transform(us_states[us_states$STUSPS == state, ], crs = "EPSG:4326")              # Load the downscaled raster output        downscale_output <- readRDS("path/to/downscale_output.rds")                # Slot in as argument to the aggregate function        result <- aggregate(downscale_output, polygon_data)        print(result)        } # }

title: Covariates for a date, with optional site filtering — debias_get_covariates_for_date

title: Covariates for a date, with optional site filtering — debias_get_covariates_for_date
text: Filters sites year `obs_date` according : - `drop_incomplete_covariates`: remove sites NA covariate features. - `enforce_consistent_obs`: remove sites became inconsistent `t_idx`. Returns data frame **year × eligible sites**, sorted `site`, attributes listing sites dropped (useful logging).

what: Map observation names -> state names — debias_name_map
title: Map observation names -> state names — debias_name_map
text: mapping applied whenever observations merged state layout. upstream naming changes, **edit ** keep rest code stable. Returns subset `candidate_sites` whose covariate row `year` **NA** covariate feature column. site flagged **inconsistent `t_idx`** missing ** variable time `t_idx` reported **earlier time** (1..`t_idx-1`). prevents training/evaluation sites drop variables mid-series. Builds vector one entry per **column `X`**, using `(site, var)` layout defined `site_index` `col_vars`. Observation names `obs.mean` remapped `name_map`. Computes RMSE state variable, separately pre- post-debias column means observations. NAs ignored per variable.

title: Apply residual debiasing for a single SDA time step — sda_apply_debias_step
text: t Integer current time index (t > 1 required train t–1). obs.t Character time label logging (e.g., ISO date string `t`). X Numeric matrix **current** ensemble time `t` (members × columns). raw_prev Numeric vector **raw** column mean `t-1`. raw_mean_t Numeric vector **raw** column mean `t`. site_index Vector site ids per column `X`. col_vars Vector variable names per column `X` (state-space names). obs.times Datetime vector indexed `t` (length ≥ `t`) covariate year lookup. obs.mean Observation structure (time → site → named numeric vector). covariates_df Long data frame columns `site`, `year`, feature columns. py Python bridge object exposing: - `train_full_model(name, X, y)`, - `predict_residual(name, X)`, - `get_model_weights(name)`, - `has_model(name)` (logical). train_buf R environment used accumulate training rows per variable across steps. name_map Optional map observation names → state names. drop_incomplete_covariates Logical; `TRUE`, drop sites missing covariates (per year). enforce_consistent_obs Logical; `TRUE`, drop sites inconsistent relevant `t_idx`. require_obs_at_t_for_predict Logical; `TRUE`, predict residuals columns state.interval Matrix/data.frame per-variable bounds; either rownames = variable columns `min`,`max`, data frame `variable` column plus `min`/`max`. Used clip post-debias values. clip_lower_bound Numeric; minimum floor applied lower bounds (default 0.01). **observations present t** (useful constrained comparisons).

title: Apply residual debiasing for a single SDA time step — sda_apply_debias_step
text: list : X **mean-shifted** ensemble matrix time `t` (dims input `X`). weights_entry Optional named list learner weights variable (provided `py`). weights_df_rows tidy data frame weights emitted step (time, var, learner, weight). diag list : `comp`: per-column comparison table (`pre`, `post`, `obs`) diagnostics. `rmse`: per-variable metrics (RMSE/MAE/bias/R²) **pre vs post**.  rmse_rows tidy slice metrics `time` column attached easy logging.

title: Apply residual debiasing for a single SDA time step — sda_apply_debias_step
text: time `t`, function: 1. Builds training set **t–1**: residuals `y = obs_prev - raw_prev` features    `[covariates_prev, raw_prev]` variable. 2. Trains/updates Python-side learner (`py$train_full_model`). 3. Predicts residuals **t** using `[covariates_t, raw_mean_t]`. 4. Mean-shifts ensemble `X` adding predicted residuals `raw_mean_t`. 5. Computes per-variable metrics (RMSE, MAE, bias, R²) pre vs post.

title: Apply residual debiasing for a single SDA time step — sda_apply_debias_step
text: - covariates missing (feature columns) either `t-1` `t`, function   returns `X` unchanged emits NA metrics (shape-preserving behavior). - Predicted residuals non-finite coerced 0 avoid contaminating `X`. - **mean-shift** keeps ensemble spread intact: subtract raw mean   add corrected mean (`raw_mean_t + predicted_residual`).
